intro: Manettia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Manettia racemosa is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
